content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Research Lab (Attempted) at Position(0.5, 2.5)
Intended to serve as a research facility by supplying Automation Science Packs for technology development. Multiple attempts were made to craft and place the Lab—but placement failed repeatedly because no Lab item was present in inventory and required sub-ingredients (such as iron‐gear wheels, electronic circuits, or copper cables) could not be produced in sufficient quantity. As a result, no Lab exists on the map.

### Iron Smelting Furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0)
Utilized for converting iron ore and coal into iron plates needed for further production. The agent accessed this furnace to insert 10 units each of iron ore and coal, resulting in the extraction of additional iron plates.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)
Employed for smelting copper ore with coal to produce copper plates that support further copper cable production. The agent retrieved this furnace to process 50 copper ore and coal, yielding 45 copper plates.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• When using get_entities(), ensure that the call adheres to its defined signature. Do not supply unexpected keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or positional arguments if none are expected.
• Prior to placing structures, verify that the required inventory item is available. This prevents failures when attempting to deploy a Lab.
• Always check that returned entity lists are not None before iterating over them; use a fallback (like an empty list) if necessary.
• Ensure that all prerequisites for crafting complex items (for example, a Lab) are met. Confirm that intermediate components such as iron‐gear wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables can be produced reliably.
• Review resource counts and buffer production as needed. Missing ingredients during Lab crafting suggest that additional resource processing (such as extra smelting runs) is required before attempting the build.
